text2: Emma found a small puppy in the park. It was brown with white spots and looked hungry. She gave it her sandwich and the puppy wagged its tail.
category: Where did Emma find the puppy?
know_more: Read carefully! The story says in the park.

text2: Emma found a small puppy in the park. It was brown with white spots and looked hungry. She gave it her sandwich and the puppy wagged its tail.
know_more: Look for color words - brown with white spots!

text2: Emma found a small puppy in the park. It was brown with white spots and looked hungry. She gave it her sandwich and the puppy wagged its tail.
category: What did Emma give the puppy?
know_more: She GAVE it her sandwich - giving means sharing!

text2: Tom made a volcano for the science fair. He used baking soda and vinegar to make it erupt. Everyone clapped and he won second place.
know_more: His project was a VOLCANO that erupted!

text2: Tom made a volcano for the science fair. He used baking soda and vinegar to make it erupt. Everyone clapped and he won second place.
know_more: Baking soda + vinegar = chemical reaction = eruption!

text2: Sarah wanted to play outside but it was raining. She built a blanket fort with her brother. They read books until the rain stopped.
know_more: Look for the reason - IT WAS RAINING!

text2: Sarah wanted to play outside but it was raining. She built a blanket fort with her brother. They read books until the rain stopped.
know_more: She BUILT a blanket fort - building with blankets!

text2: Sarah wanted to play outside but it was raining. She built a blanket fort with her brother. They read books until the rain stopped.
know_more: WITH her brother means he helped!

text2: Jake went to the library with his grandmother. He found a book about dinosaurs and the librarian helped him check it out.
know_more: The first sentence tells us - the LIBRARY!

text2: Jake went to the library with his grandmother. He found a book about dinosaurs and the librarian helped him check it out.
know_more: He found a book ABOUT DINOSAURS!

text2: Mom baked a cake for Dads birthday. She used chocolate frosting. When Dad came home he was surprised and happy.
know_more: Mom BAKED a CAKE - look for the action and object!

text2: Mom baked a cake for Dads birthday. She used chocolate frosting. When Dad came home he was surprised and happy.
know_more: Look for feeling words - SURPRISED and HAPPY!

text2: Maria wanted a pet. Her parents took her to the animal shelter. She chose a small orange kitten named Whiskers.
category: Where did Maria get her pet?
know_more: The story says they went to the ANIMAL SHELTER!

text2: Tom planted tomato seeds in his garden. He watered them every day. After two months small red tomatoes grew.
Tom planted tomato seeds in his garden. He watered them every day. After two months small red tomatoes grew.

Anna practiced violin for months. On concert night she played beautifully. The audience clapped for five minutes.
know_more: She practiced and played the VIOLIN!

text2: Anna practiced violin for months. On concert night she played beautifully. The audience clapped for five minutes.

Zog the alien wanted to have a picnic on the moon. He packed green sandwiches and moon cheese. He flew his silver rocket ship past three bright stars. When he landed, he saw his friend Beep-Boop the robot. They sat on a crater and watched the Earth spin. It was a beautiful blue ball in the dark sky. Zog shared his sandwich, and Beep-Boop shared his oil juice. They were happy best friends.
know_more: Did you read about the food?
hint: He packed green sandwiches and moon cheese.

hint: When he landed, he saw his friend Beep-Boop the robot.

text2: Sparky was a small dragon who could not breathe fire. He could only breathe bubbles! The other dragons laughed at him. One day, a forest fire started near the village. The big dragons tried to stomp it out, but it was too hot. Sparky flew over the fire and blew thousands of giant wet bubbles. Pop! Pop! The bubbles burst and water splashed everywhere. The fire went out! The village was saved, and Sparky was a hero.
know_more: What came out of his mouth?

know_more: How did he stop the fire?

text2: Lily found a rusty old key in her grandmother's attic. It had a shape of a heart on top. She tried it on the front door, but it didn't work. She tried it on her jewelry box, but it was too big. Then she saw a dusty wooden chest in the corner. She put the key in the lock and turned it. Click! The chest opened. Inside was a beautiful dress made of blue silk. It was her grandmother's favorite dress.
hint: Lily found a rusty old key in her grandmother's attic.

text2:
A little seed for me to sow
A little earth to make it grow
A little hole, a little pat,
A little wish, and that is that,
A little sun, a little shower,
A little while - and then, a flower!
know_more: What does the seed need to grow?

I have a little shadow that goes in and out with me,
And what can be the use of him is more than I can see.
He is very, very like me from the heels up to the head;
And I see him jump before me, when I jump into my bed.

White sheep, white sheep,
On a blue hill,
When the wind stops,
You all stand still.
When the wind blows,
You walk away slow.
White sheep, white sheep,
Where do you go?

Sixty seconds make a minute,
How much good can I do in it?
Sixty minutes make an hour,
All the good that's in my power.
know_more: How many seconds in a minute?

Snow makes the world look new and clean,
The prettiest sight I've ever seen.
It covers up the dirt and grime,
And makes the world a happy rhyme.

Books are keys to wisdom's treasure,
Books are gates to lands of pleasure;
Books are paths that upward lead,
Books are friends. Come, let us read.
